title: Michigan Firm Recalls Calzone Products for Possible Listeria Contamination
summary: WASHINGTON, April 20, 2012 - Albie's Foods, a Gaylord, Mich. establishment, is recalling approximately 311 pounds of pizza calzone products due to possible contamination with Listeria monocytogenes, the U.S. Department of Agriculture's Food Safety and Inspection Service (FSIS) announced today. The fully cooked, ready-to-eat, calzone...
impacted_products: Packages containing 48 4.5-oz. pieces of "Albie's Pizza Calzone."
